briefdescription.para: Properties of parent blocks are merged and stored on child elements (i.e. paragraphs or tables).

detaileddescription.para: Properties of parent blocks are merged as follows: margins are added together; borders of higher-level blocks are discarded and only the most inner-level borders are preserved. As a result, when this mode is specified, some formatting of blocks from the original document will be lost.
On the other hand, since all merged block-level properties are stored on document nodes, all formating in the resulting document will be available for modification.

briefdescription.para: Properties of parent blocks are imported to a special logical structure and are stored separately from document nodes.

detaileddescription.para: Only margins and borders of 'body', 'div', and 'blockquote' HTML elements are imported. Properties of each HTML element are stored individually.

This mode allows to better preserve borders and margins seen in the HTML document and get better conversion results. The downside is that the resulting document gets harder to modify, since borders and margins stored in the logical structure are not available for editing.
This mode mimics MS Word's behavior regarding import of block properties.

briefdescription.para: Specifies how properties of block-level elements are imported from HTML-based documents.
Left to right direction.
Right to left direction.
Auto-detect direction.
Allows to specify the direction to flow the text in a document.
Specifies the editing language.
Type of document nodes that represent <input> and <select> elements imported from HTML.
Aspose.Words will load this resource as usual.
Aspose.Words will skip loading of this resource. Only link without data will be stored for an image, CSS style sheet will be ignored for HTML format.
Aspose.Words will use byte array provided by user in SetData() as resource data.
Specifies the mode of resource loading.
Image.
Css style sheet.
Document.
Type of loaded resource.
Specifies available options for leading space handling during import from Text file.
Specifies available options for trailing spaces handling during import from Text file.
The Aspose.Words.Loading namespace provides classes and enumerations that allow to specify additional options when loading documents.
